text: Hungarian Judo Association (, MJSZ) is the governing body for the sport of judo in Hungary. ==International competitions in Hungary== World Championships: *2017 World Judo Championships – Budapest, European Championships: *1981 European Judo Championships – Debrecen, 14-17 May *2013 European Judo Championships – Budapest, 25-28 April ==International achievements== {| class="wikitable" width="70%" style="font-size:90%; text- align:center;" !Event |20x20px |18x18px |18x18px |Pos. |- | align="left" |Olympic Games |1 |3 |5 |21st |- | align="left" |World Championships |2 |7 |15 |24th |- | align="left" |European Championships |17 |28 |45 |13th |} ===Olympic Games=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font- size:95%;" |- !Year !Host city !No. of judokas |width=40 bgcolor=gold align="center" |Gold |width=40 bgcolor=silver align="center" |Silver |width=4 bgcolor=#cc9966 align="center" |Bronze !width=40 |Total |- align="center" | 1972 |align="left" | Munich |5 |style="background:#F7F6A8;" | 0 |style="background:#DCE5E5;" | 0 |style="background:#FFDAB9;" | 0 |0 | -
